channel.title: Assignment Statements :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: Assignment statements in a program come in two forms â€“ with and without mutations. Assignments without mutation are those that give a value to a variable without using the old value of that variable. Assignments with mutation are variable assignments that use the old value of a variable to calculate a value for the variable. For example, an increment statement like x = x + 1 MUTATES the value of x by updating its value to be one bigger than it was before. In order to make sense of such a statement, we need to know the previous value of x.
